Package models

Class GameState

  • java.lang.Object
    • models.GameState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.concurrent.Flow.Publisher<GameState.Patch>
    public class GameState
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.concurrent.Flow.Publisher<GameState.Patch>
    Models the state of a game of TicTacToe and provides an interface to mutate that state.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  GameState.Patch
      Describes an atomic update to the game state.
      static class  GameState.Status
      Describes where in the game is in it's lifecycle.

    • Field Detail

      • currentPlayerIndex

        private int currentPlayerIndex
        The index of the player whose turn it is in the players tuple.

      • emptyCells

        private int emptyCells
        A count of how many cells on the board are empty. Used to detect draws.

      • grid

        private Player[][] grid
        A model of the board. Always square with dimensions GRID_SIZExGRID_SIZE. Elements are null if the cell has not been played to, or equal to a player object from the players tuple if that player has made a move to the cell.

      • gameMode

        private GameMode gameMode
        Flag for the type of game mode being played.

      • players

        private org.javatuples.Pair<Player,​Player> players
        Stores the players in the game.

      • publisher

        private java.util.concurrent.SubmissionPublisher<GameState.Patch> publisher
        A Flow.Publisher implementation that handles our subscriptions.

      • secondaryOption

        private int secondaryOption
        Some game modes requires additional configuration, and that is stored here. For instance, GameMode.BEST_OF_X uses this field to track the number of games being played, while GameMode.BULLET uses it to track the timer's initial value.

      • singlePlayer

        private boolean singlePlayer
        Whether or not the game is single player. Single player games are played against the AI.

      • status

        private GameState.Status status
        The current status of the game in it's lifecycle.

      • victoryCounts

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> victoryCounts
        Storage used for detecting win states. Each cell keeps a running total of the 'score' in a winnable lane (i.e. row, column, or diagonal). When player one makes a play to the lane, that total increments; when player two makes a play, it decrements. When the absolute value of the total is equal to the grid size, a player has won. The first x=GRID_SIZE elements correspond to the grid's rows, then the next y=GRID_SIZE elements (i.e. GRID_SIZE + y) correspond to the grid's columns. The final two elements located at GRID_SIZE * 2 and (GRID_SIZE * 2) + 1 correspond to the left-to-right and right-to-left diagonals.

      • winner

        private Player winner
        The winner of the game. Equal to null unless the game has been won.

      • GRID_SIZE

        private final int GRID_SIZE
        The dimensions fo the grid.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameState

        public GameState()
        Creates a default game: single player, free play, and with both players set to null.

      • GameState

        public GameState​(GameMode gameMode,
                 org.javatuples.Pair<Player,​Player> players,
                 java.lang.Boolean singlePlayer)
        Creates a game for modes that do not need to configure a secondary option.
        Parameters:
        gameMode - The game mode that the game should operate in.
        players - A 2-tuple with the first and second players in the game.
        singlePlayer - True if player one should be versing the AI, false if both players are human.

      • GameState

        public GameState​(GameMode gameMode,
                 org.javatuples.Pair<Player,​Player> players,
                 java.lang.Boolean singlePlayer,
                 int secondaryOption)
        Creates a game for modes that do have a secondary option.
        Parameters:
        gameMode - The game mode that the game should operate in.
        players - A 2-tuple with the first and second players in the game.
        singlePlayer - True if player one should be versing the AI, false if both players are human.
        secondaryOption - The game mode's secondary option value. The meaning of this option is contextual based on the game mode.

      • getVictoryArr

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getVictoryArr()
        Returns a victoryArray for the current game state. This array is a clone of the internal array and is safe to mutate.

      • getWinner

        public Player getWinner()
        Returns the game's winner.

      • getCell

        public Player getCell​(int x,
                      int y)
        Look up who has played to a certain cell.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the cell.
        y - The y-coordinate of the cell.
        Returns:
        Returns a Player object describing the player who controls cell [x, y], or null if no player has.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if either x or y fails to satisfy 0 <= n < GRID_SIZE

      • setCell

        public void setCell​(int x,
                    int y)
        Have a player play to a given cell. Marks the cell as theirs and checks for victory conditions. If the game continues, then the current player will be updated.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the cell.
        y - The y-coordinate of the cell.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if: either x or y does not satisfy 0 <= n < GRID_SIZE, or the specified cell is not empty.

      • subscribe

        public void subscribe​(java.util.concurrent.Flow.Subscriber<? super GameState.Patch> subscriber)
        Subscribe to receive updates whenever the game's state updates.
        Specified by:
        subscribe in interface java.util.concurrent.Flow.Publisher<GameState.Patch>
